sense.name: Put at risk.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 STAKE NP2 on NP3
sense.examples: He staked his eternal destiny solely on the right-standing with God that Jesus offers everyone. He staked his reputation on school finance reform.

sense.name: Place a bet.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 STAKE on NP2
sense.examples: Those people who exaggerate all this fuss are staking on the lame horse. He lost his money, which he staked on a horse race.

sense.name: Mark (as if) with a stake; make a claim to.
sense.commentary: Includes: STAKE OUT Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] STAKE out NP2[patient[inanimate]] NP1[agent] STAKE NP2
sense.examples: Griffey has staked out his own path. Beenie Man has staked out his territory. He staked a claim to his father's fortune. Microsoft has staked a major claim in the video gaming industry.

sense.name: Physically fasten to a stake.
sense.examples: Lewis Kirk staked the Mountain Goat. A farmer staked his goat at the corner of the barn. He staked the child to the ground.

sense.name: Impale; kill with a stake.
sense.examples: She did a back flip and staked an unsuspecting vampire. We've shot him, stabbed him, clubbed him, sprayed him with holy water, staked him through the heart, and STILL he lives!
